policies.name: L_DisplayDeveloperTab
policies.displayName: Display Developer tab in the Ribbon
policies.explainText:
This policy setting controls whether the Developer tab will be displayed in the Ribbon.

If you enable this policy setting, the Developer tab will be displayed in the Ribbon.

If you disable this policy setting, the Developer tab will not be displayed in the Ribbon.

If you do not configure this policy setting, the Developer tab will not be displayed in the Ribbon, but its visibility can be changed via a setting in the application Options dialog box.

policies.name: L_ShowTheNewTemplateGalleryWhenStartingPublisher
policies.displayName: Show the New template gallery when starting Publisher
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_TurnOffDragPreview
policies.displayName: Turn off drag preview
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to determine whether Publisher shows a semi-transparent drag preview or a simple outline of the object when the object is dragged.

If you enable this policy setting, only the outline of the object is shown while being dragged.  This is the recommended setting for older machines because of the resource requirements of this feature.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, a semi-transparent drag preview of the object is shown while being dragged.

policies.name: L_SetMaximumNumberOfMRUItemsToDisplay
policies.displayName: Number of publications in the Recent Publications list
policies.explainText:
This policy setting specifies the number of entries displayed in the Recent Publications list that appears when users click Open on the File tab in Backstage view.  

If you enable this policy setting, you can specify the number of entries to be between 0 and 50. If you set the number to 0, all pinned and unpinned entries are hidden.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, a maximum of 25 items will be displayed in the Recent Publications list.

Note: If you want to prevent items from being added to the Recent Publications list entirely, you can enable the "Do not keep history of recently opened documents" Windows policy setting.

policies.name: L_SetNumberOfPlacesInTheRecentPlacesList
policies.displayName: Number of folders in the Recent Folders list
policies.explainText:
This policy setting specifies the number of unpinned entries displayed in the Recent Folders list that appears when users click Open or Save As on the File tab in Backstage view.

If you enable this policy setting, you can specify the number of unpinned entries to be between 0 and 20. If you set the number to 0, all pinned and unpinned entries are hidden.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, a maximum of 5 unpinned items are displayed in the Recent Folders list.

Note: If you want to prevent items from being added to the Recent Folders list entirely, you can enable the "Do not keep history of recently opened documents" Windows policy setting.

policies.name: L_UseXPSEnhancedPrintPath
policies.displayName: Use XPS-enhanced print path
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to use XPS-enhanced print path when available. 

If you enable or do not configure this policy setting, the XPS print path will be used.

If you disable this policy setting, the XPS print path is not used.

policies.name: L_AutomaticallysubstitutefontformissingEAchars
policies.displayName: Automatically substitute font for missing East Asian characters
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_SetDefaultTextFlowDirection
policies.displayName: Set default text flow direction
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to set the default text flow between Right-to-Left (RTL) and Left-to-Right (LTR). 

If you enable this policy setting, you may choose whether text will flow RTL or LTR.

If you disable or not configure this policy setting, the default text flow setting is used.

policies.name: L_AutomaticallySwitchKeyboard
policies.displayName: Automatically switch keyboard to match the language of surrounding text
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_AllowTextToBeDraggedAndDropped
policies.displayName: Allow text to be dragged and dropped
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Whenselectingautomaticallyselectentireword
policies.displayName: When selecting, automatically select entire word
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Whenformattingautomaticallyformatentireword
policies.displayName: When formatting, automatically format entire word
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_UseChinesefontsizes
policies.displayName: Use Chinese font sizes
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_AutomaticallyHyphenateInNewTextBoxes
policies.displayName: Automatically hyphenate in new text boxes
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the option ''Automatically hyphenate in new text boxes''.

policies.name: L_ShowScreenTipsonobjects
policies.displayName: Show ScreenTips on objects
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Enableincrementalpublishtoweb
policies.displayName: Enable incremental publish to Web
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Sendentirepublicationasasingle
policies.displayName: Send entire publication as a single JPEG image
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Promptuserwhenreapplyingastyle
policies.displayName: Prompt user when reapplying a style
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_SaveAutoRecoverinfoevery
policies.displayName: Save AutoRecover info every (minutes)
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to specify the Save Autorecover interval in minutes.

If you enable this policy setting, you may specify the Save Autorecover interval in minutes (valid range: 1-120).

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the interval specified in the UI will be used.

policies.name: L_Allowbackgroundsaves
policies.displayName: Allow background saves
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Checkspellingasyoutype
policies.displayName: Check spelling as you type
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to configure options for spelling errors.

If you enable this policy setting, you may choose one of these options:
-  Check spelling as you type: This option is checked.
-  Hide spelling errors: This option is checked, but "Check spelling as you type" is unchecked.
- Both: "Check spelling as you type" and "Hide spelling errors" are both checked.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the "Check spelling as you type" option is checked.

policies.name: L_Promptusertosetupprinter
policies.displayName: Prompt user to setup printer
policies.explainText: When set, Publisher will show a prompt to the user to start the Printer Setup Wizard when a new printer is found.

policies.name: L_DefaultPublisherdirection
policies.displayName: Default Publisher direction
policies.explainText: Specifies the default layout orientation.

policies.name: L_UseSequenceChecking
policies.displayName: Use sequence checking
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Usetypeandreplace
policies.displayName: Use type and replace
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_AdddoublequotesinHebrewalphabetnumbering
policies.displayName: Add double quotes in Hebrew alphabet numbering
policies.explainText: Checked: Adds double quotation marks ('') to Hebrew numbering. | Unchecked: Does not add double quotation marks ('') to Hebrew numbering.

policies.name: L_DisableOfficeStartPublisher
policies.displayName: Disable the Office Start screen for Publisher
policies.explainText:
This policy setting controls whether the Office Start screen appears on boot for Publisher.

If you enable this policy setting, users will not see the Office Start screen when they boot Publisher.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, users will see the Office Start screen when they boot Publisher.

Note: This policy setting is overridden by the policy setting "Microsoft Office 2016 > Miscellaneous > Disable the Office Start screen for all Office applications" if that policy setting is set.

policies.name: L_PersonalTemplatesPath
policies.displayName: Personal templates path for Publisher
policies.explainText:
This policy setting specifies the location of a user's personal templates. 

If you enable this policy setting, users will see any templates they have saved in the specified location in the custom templates tab on the Office Start screen and in File | New and when saving a template their default folder will change to be the specified location. 

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, users will not see templates they have saved in the custom templates tab on the Office Start screen and in File | New and when saving a template their default folder will be their document save location.

policies.name: L_DefaultBuiltInTab
policies.displayName: Default tab to show in Publisher on the Office Start screen and in File | New
policies.explainText:
This policy setting controls what displays as the default tab in Publisher on the Office Start screen and in File | New. 

If you enable this policy setting, you can choose one of two options to become the default tab on the Office Start screen and in File | New:

* Built-in – Users will the see built-in templates tab as the default tab in Publisher on the Office Start screen and in File | New.

* Custom – Users will the see custom templates tab as the default tab in Publisher on the Office Start screen and in File | New when templates exist (this can include Custom XML programmed templates, templates in the Workgroup templates path, templates in the Personal templates path, or SharePoint templates).

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, users will see the Featured templates tab as the default tab in Publisher on the Office Start screen and in File | New

policies.name: L_publisherVisualRefresh
policies.displayName: Visual refresh settings
policies.explainText:
Enable or disable visual refresh. may not work for some versions of Office.

Data provided by Office Tool Plus.
